sentence.text: Leucine-rich glioma-inactivated protein 1 (axon guidance) is a secreted neuronal protein and a Nogo receptor 1 (cytokine-mediated signaling pathway) ligand.

Mutations in axon guidance in humans causes autosomal dominant lateral temporal lobe epilepsy and homozygous deletion of axon guidance in mice results in severe epileptic seizures that cause early postnatal death.

regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton activity is significantly increased in cortical cultures derived from axon guidance null mice and using a reconstituted system; we show directly that LGI1 antagonizes cytokine-mediated signaling pathway-tumor necrosis factor receptor orphan Y (TROY) signaling.

entity.text: regulation of modification of postsynaptic actin cytoskeleton
